item.title: 波音公司在 8 月停飞后恢复 777X 试飞
item.description: 波音公司于本周四恢复了推迟已久的 777X 宽体喷气式飞机的测试，这是该美国飞机制造商自 8 月份因关键发动机安装结构故障而停飞测试机队以来的首次飞行。【原文：Boeing resumed testing for its long-delayed 777X widebody jet on Thursday, with the first flight since the U.S. planemaker grounded the test fleet in August due to the failure of a key engine mounting structure.】

item.title: VIEW 中国第四季度经济同比增长5.4%，高于市场预期
item.description: 周五的官方数据显示，中国第四季度经济同比增长5.4%，大幅超出分析师预期，使政府得以实现全年增长目标。【原文：China's economy grew 5.4% in the fourth quarter from a year earlier, official data showed on Friday, significantly beating analysts' expectations and enabling the government to meet its annual growth target.】

item.title: 中国经济增长在刺激政策推动下超过预期
item.description: 在一系列刺激措施的帮助下，中国经济在 2024 年年底的表现好于预期，尽管与美国爆发新贸易战的威胁和国内需求疲软可能会损害对今年更广泛复苏的信心。【原文：China's economy ended 2024 on better footing than expected helped by a flurry of stimulus measures, although the threat of a new trade war with the United States and weak domestic demand could hurt confidence in a broader recovery this year.】

item.title: 中国第四季度 GDP 同比增长 5.4% 高于市场预期
item.description: 周五的官方数据显示，中国第四季度经济同比增长5.4%，大幅超出分析师预期，使政府得以实现全年增长目标。【原文：China's economy grew 5.4% in the fourth quarter from a year earlier, official data showed on Friday, significantly beating analysts' expectations and enabling the government to meet its annual growth target.】

item.title: 油价因供应担忧和美联储降息希望而攀升
item.description: 受美国制裁俄罗斯石油生产商后供应趋紧的担忧以及美联储官员发出的可能降息的信号推动，周五油价攀升，有望实现连续第四个星期上涨。【原文：Oil prices climbed on Friday, heading for a fourth weekly gain, driven by concerns over tighter supply following U.S. sanctions on Russian oil producers and signals from a Federal Reserve official of potential interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 受日本央行加息押注影响，日元将迎来一个多月来最好的一周
item.description: 随着日本央行下周将加息的预期升温，日元有望创下一个多月来最强劲的单周表现，这使得美元在唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫之前处于不利地位。【原文：The yen was poised for its strongest weekly performance in over a month as expectations grow that the Bank of Japan will raise rates next week, putting the dollar on the back foot ahead of Donald Trump's return to the White House.】

item.title: 韩国核电站运营商与美国西屋公司就结束争端达成协议
item.description: 韩国核电站运营商韩国水电与核电公司（Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power）和国家公用事业公司韩国电力公司（KEPCO）周五表示，已与美国西屋公司（Westinghouse）达成协议，结束双方的知识产权纠纷。【原文：South Korea's nuclear power plant operator Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power and state utility Korea Electric Power Corp (KEPCO) have reached an agreement with United States' Westinghouse to end their intellectual property dispute, KEPCO said on Friday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Meta 的 "社区笔记 "模式将不适用于付费广告
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Facebook 母公司 Meta 本周向广告商保证，其 "社区笔记"（类似于埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）旗下社交媒体平台 X 上使用的 "社区笔记"）将不适用于今年晚些时候推出的付费广告。【原文：Facebook parent Meta assured advertisers this week that its "Community Notes", similar to that used on Elon Musk-owned social media platform X, will not apply to paid ads when they arrive later this year, the Wall Street Journal reported.】

item.title: 特朗普的财政部长人选贝森特表示美国必须保持对国债的监督
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的财政部长人选斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四告诉国会，美国应继续监督美国债券市场的潜在问题，他提到了华尔街亿万富翁霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）通过一家英国公司清算国债期货的计划。【原文：The United States should keep oversight of potential problems in the U.S. bond market, President-elect Donald Trump's Treasury Secretary pick Scott Bessent told Congress on Thursday, referring to Wall Street billionaire Howard Lutnick's plan to clear Treasury futures through a UK firm.】

item.title: 联邦存款保险公司就硅谷银行倒闭起诉 17 名前高管和董事
item.description: 联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）周四起诉了硅谷银行（Silicon Valley Bank）的 17 名前高管和董事，要求他们赔偿数十亿美元，因为他们涉嫌严重失职和违反信托责任，导致该银行于 2023 年 3 月倒闭，这是美国最大的银行倒闭案之一。【原文：The FDIC on Thursday sued 17 former executives and directors of Silicon Valley Bank, seeking to recover billions of dollars for alleged gross negligence and breaches of fiduciary duty that caused the bank's March 2023 collapse, one of the largest U.S. banking failures.】

item.title: 头发着火 "的广告商为美国 TikTok 禁令做好准备
item.description: 本周，依赖 TikTok 作为主要数字营销工具的广告商们急忙准备应急计划，因为许多人意识到，在美国禁令于周日生效之前，这款由中国人拥有的流行社交媒体应用可能无法挽救。【原文：Advertisers reliant on TikTok as a major digital marketing tool rushed to prepare contingency plans this week, as the realization dawned on many that the popular Chinese-owned social media app may not be saved before a U.S. ban takes effect on Sunday.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表称中国造船业损害美国利益可采取行动
item.description: 美国贸易代表称，其对中国在海运、物流和造船领域的主导地位的贸易调查 "不合理，并负担或限制了美国商业"。 美国贸易代表周四表示，其调查结果为采取 "回应性 "行动提供了依据，但并未提出建议。【原文：The U.S. Trade Representative said its trade probe of China's dominance of the maritime, logistics and shipbuilding sector is "unreasonable and burdens or restricts U.S. commerce." USTR said on Thursday that its findings for a basis for "responsive" action but does not provide a recommendation.】

item.title: 参议院民主党人向拜登施压，要求推迟 TikTok 禁令
item.description: 越来越多的立法者敦促美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）批准缓刑，以防止 TikTok 最快于周日在美国停用，并警告说数百万创作者和企业可能会受到伤害。【原文：A growing number of lawmakers are urging President Joe Biden to grant a reprieve to prevent TikTok from going dark in the United States as soon as Sunday, warning millions of creators and businesses could be hurt.】

item.title: 殖民地管道公司预计 1 号线周五重启时间将早于预期
item.description: 殖民地管道公司（Colonial Pipeline）周四表示，该公司在确定其汽油主干道泄漏源方面取得了进展，预计一号线将于周五提前重启。【原文：Colonial Pipeline has made progress in identifying the source of a leak on its main gasoline artery and estimates Line 1 will restart earlier-than-expected on Friday, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国有望实现 2024 年 GDP 目标，但关税问题迫在眉睫
item.description: 随着几轮政策刺激的启动，中国经济在第四季度可能出现反弹，使政府基本实现了2024年的增长目标，但美国新关税的风险可能会阻碍更广泛的复苏。【原文：China's economy likely rebounded in the fourth quarter as several rounds of policy stimulus kicked in, enabling the government to largely meet its 2024 growth target, though the risk of new U.S. tariffs could hold back a broader recovery.】

item.title: SpaceX 在模拟卫星部署测试中发射第七艘星际飞船
item.description: 美国太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）周四在得克萨斯州发射了迄今为止最大的星际飞船原型火箭，这是该公司第七次执行试验任务，将尝试在太空部署火箭的首批模拟卫星。【原文：SpaceX on Thursday launched its biggest Starship prototype rocket yet in a seventh test mission from Texas that will attempt to deploy the rocket's first mock satellites in space, a company live stream showed.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会就投资模型漏洞对美国对冲基金的指控达成和解
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周四就对冲基金 Two Sigma 未能解决其投资模型中已知漏洞的指控达成和解。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday settled charges against hedge fund Two Sigma over failure to address known vulnerabilities in its investment models, the regulatory agency said.】

item.title: 特朗普的美国财政部人选称废除债务限额问题 "细致入微
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）选择的财政部负责人斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四表示，取消美国债务限额的问题 "有细微差别"，但他表示，如果特朗普希望取消债务限额，他将与特朗普和国会合作完成这项工作。【原文：Scott Bessent, U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's choice to head the Treasury Department, on Thursday said the question of eliminating the U.S. debt limit is "nuanced," but said if Trump wants to do so he will work with him and with Congress to get it done.】

item.title: Lyft 赢得股东对财报错误诉讼的驳回
item.description: 联邦法官周四驳回了一起指控 Lyft 欺骗股东的诉讼，该诉讼指控 Lyft 过久才纠正财报中关于一项关键利润指标的错误，这一错误导致这家共享单车公司的股价大幅波动。【原文：A federal judge on Thursday dismissed a lawsuit accusing Lyft of defrauding shareholders by waiting too long to correct a mistake in an earnings release about a key profit metric, an error that caused the ride-sharing company's stock price to gyrate wildly.】

item.title: 早间竞价：等待中国数据，美国收益率走低
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 星巴克首席独立董事梅洛迪-霍布森将离职
item.description: 咖啡巨头星巴克周四表示，公司董事会首席独立董事梅洛迪-霍布森（Mellody Hobson）将离职。【原文：Coffee giant Starbucks said on Thursday that Mellody Hobson, the lead independent director of the company's board, will depart.】

item.title: 美国财政部研究发现：在气候风险地区，美国房屋保险费用涨幅更大
item.description: 美国财政部周四发布的一份研究报告显示，在最有可能遭受飓风、野火和其他气候灾害破坏的地区，房主支付的保险费用远远高于那些居住在风险最小地区的房主。【原文：Homeowners in areas most at risk of damage from hurricanes, wildfires and other climate perils pay far more for insurance than those who live in the least exposed areas, according to a U.S. Treasury Department study released on Thursday.】

item.title: 美泰首席财务官 DiSilvestro 将退休
item.description: 芭比娃娃母公司美泰公司周四表示，首席财务官 Anthony DiSilvestro 将于 5 月 15 日退休。【原文：Barbie parent Mattel said on Thursday Chief Financial Officer Anthony DiSilvestro will retire on May 15.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会禁止通用汽车向消费者报告机构披露驾驶员和消费者数据
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（Federal Trade Commission）周四在一份声明中表示，将禁止美国通用汽车公司在五年内向消费者报告机构披露消费者的敏感地理位置和驾驶员行为数据。【原文：U.S. automaker General Motors will be banned for five years from disclosing consumers' sensitive geolocation and driver behavior data to consumer reporting agencies, the Federal Trade Commission said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院解除对诺华仿制药 Entresto 的禁令
item.description: 周四，在美国上诉法院结束了对 MSN 推出其仿制版诺华大片心脏衰竭药物 Entresto 的临时禁令后，制药商 MSN 制药公司在推出其仿制版诺华大片心脏衰竭药物 Entresto 的道路上又扫清了一个障碍。【原文：Drugmaker MSN Pharmaceuticals cleared another hurdle on Thursday toward launching its generic version of Novartis' blockbuster heart-failure drug Entresto after a U.S. appeals court ended a temporary pause on MSN's launch.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，施罗德公司将裁员 3
item.description: 彭博新闻社周四援引一位熟知内情的人士的话报道称，施罗德公司正计划裁员约 3%。【原文：Schroders is planning to lay off about 3% of its workforce, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会将Snapchat有关人工智能聊天机器人的投诉移交给司法部
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（Federal Trade Commission）周四表示，已将针对 Snap 公司的投诉移交给司法部，该投诉称 Snapchat 的信息应用 Snapchat 使用了人工智能聊天框，对年轻用户造成了伤害。【原文：U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Thursday it has referred to the Justice Department a complaint against Snap, Inc., that alleges its messaging app Snapchat used an artificial intelligence chatbox that harmed young users.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会和科罗拉多州起诉房地产公司 Greystar，称租房者被隐性收费欺骗
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（FTC）周四表示，美国联邦贸易委员会和科罗拉多州已对一家多户租赁物业管理公司 Greystar 提起诉讼，指控该公司在租赁费用方面以隐藏费用欺骗消费者。 "联邦贸易委员会主席莉娜-M-汗（Lina M. Khan）在声明中说："联邦贸易委员会起诉 Greystar 公司欺骗性地宣传低月租，但随后却向租户收取数百美元的隐藏垃圾费。 Greystar 在周四的一份声明中否认了这一指控。 "Greystar 发言人在声明中说："联邦贸易委员会非但没有与 Greystar 合作，帮助推动住房租赁行业对消费者有意义的改善，反而在本届政府任期的最后几天选择了抢头条的诉讼。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission and the State of Colorado have filed a complaint against Greystar, a multi-family rental property manager, alleging that it deceived consumers about rental costs with hidden fees, the FTC said on Thursday. "The FTC is suing Greystar for deceptively advertising low monthly rents only to later saddle tenants with hundreds of dollars of hidden junk fees,” FTC Chair Lina M. Khan said in the statement. Greystar denied the allegations in a statement on Thursday. "Rather than working with Greystar to help drive meaningful improvements for consumers in the rental housing industry, the FTC has opted for headline-grabbing litigation in the waning days of the current administration," a Greystar spokesperson said in the statement.】

item.title: 亿万富翁麦考特对在任何 TikTok 交易中保留原始投资者持开放态度
item.description: 美国亿万富翁弗兰克-麦考特周四告诉路透社，他对TikTok收购中国短视频应用TikTok美国业务的任何交易保持 "开放态度"，包括创始人在内的TikTok现有投资者将继续参与。【原文：Businessman Frank McCourt is "open-minded" to keeping TikTok's existing investors, including the founder, involved after any deal to buy the U.S. operations of the Chinese-owned short-form video app, the U.S. billionaire told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 诺和诺德控股希望将康泰伦特的规模扩大一倍，着眼于特朗普对美国制造业的关注
item.description: 诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）的控股股东诺和诺德控股公司（Novo Holdings）的一位投资公司高级合伙人表示，该公司希望在五年内将其最近收购的合同药品制造商康泰伦特（Catalent）的规模扩大一倍，以应对美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）可能对美国制造业的关注。【原文：Novo Holdings, the controlling shareholder of Novo Nordisk , hopes to double the size of its recently acquired contract drugmaker Catalent over five years, a senior partner at the investment firm said, as it prepares for a likely focus on U.S. manufacturing by President-elect Donald Trump.】
